official-title.#text: To require the Secretary of Homeland Security to prepare a comprehensive security assessment of the transportation security card program, and for other purposes.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text: Essential Transportation Worker Identification Credential Assessment Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: Comprehensive security assessment of the transportation security card program

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Committee on Homeland Security of the House of Representatives
Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation of the Senate

, as conducted by an independent not-for-profit laboratory with appropriate expertise.

text.#text: Not later than one year after the date of enactment of this Act, the
an evaluation of the extent to which the program, as implemented, addresses known security risks in the maritime environment;
an evaluation of the extent to which internal control deficiencies identified by the
a cost-benefit analysis of the program, as implemented, and a consideration of alternate biometric technologies that provide the same or greater security effectiveness, including—
technologies and programs, including the biometric entry and exit system required by

international technologies and programs that are operational, particularly for purposes of access control to critical infrastructure; and
